experience: You and Bret both know Eric Keosky-Smith, Ed Nusbaum, and 56 others
Congrats Stephanie Nowack for being an honoree for the Phoenix Business Journal's 2017 C-Suite Awards! https://goo.gl/tctNEn
OH has won its first Emmy! Thank you to everyone who was involved with the work we created with First Things First. We can't wait to share this with our team at the office.

My business partner, Margie Traylor, and I thought we were starting an agency focused on the role of content in establishing digital and live relationships between brands and the people they serve. That was back in 1999 before content was vogue, so we pivoted and built one of the largest digital advertising and marketing agencies in Arizona. I currently serve as President of the agency and oversee a talented crew who deliver true business outcomes to the clients we serve.

Cast & Hue is a human-centered design and transformation consultancy, combining empathy, insights, behavioral nudges, and technology to transform a brand’s competitive advantage. By enlightening the brand-customer relationship through the perspective of the customer, we create exceptional experiences. My role is to oversee the managing director of the firm with a specific advisory role centered around customer satisfaction.
Co-created an influencer marketing organization through the confluence of Pushpin TV (a YouTube MCN), BOLO (a digital conference) and the internal influencer marketing practice at Sitewire.
Professor of Practice, W.P. Carey School of Business

I teach MKT440, Digital Marketing in Practice; MKT450, Social Media and Content Marketing and MKT591, Marketing Communications: Social Media. In addition, I proudly serve as the faculty advisor to AdWorks, a student run ad agency within the university experience.
I oversee the business side of Big Bounce and advise late-stage disruptive startups, helping transform them to sustainable businesses.

Assistant Digital Media Coordinator at Sun Devil Athletics
July 10, 2013, Daniel reported directly to Bret

Before Bret's Social Media/Content Strategy class at ASU I had a vague idea of how my marketing degree was relevant in today's digital sphere. Yet six month's later I now carry out and execute the principles and concepts that Bret preached in his class. An ideal instructor, he never hesitated to take time after class to go more in depth on core concepts and guided us through the plethora of social media tools and ideas. I highly recommend his courses on digital marketing and strategy at Arizona State University.

Sam Mesquita
Changing Lives Every Day Through Passionate and Creative Marketing
August 18, 2017, Bret was Sam’s teacher

When you meet Sam, you know this is someone you want to hang out with and learn more about.  He is not afraid to take on projects and views new experiences with curiosity and with the potential for learning. In fact, he learns with amazing speed and ease, making him a valuable asset to an organization in which autonomy is rewarded, where employees focused on continuous improvements are encouraged. Sam is a people person and works to maintain and grow relationships over time. His professionalism and long-term perspective belie his age, and his demeanor and candor are indicative of people who have been part of the business world much longer. I'm glad Sam opted to take one of my classes and I would recommend you meet him and see firsthand what makes him such a distinctive and gifted person.

Tina is one of those go-to people who makes things happen and has your back. I really enjoyed working with her, as she brought a perspective that I respect, a tenacity that I envy and a confidence that enables her to be persuasive without being pushy. I would work with Tina again in a minute...and hope that happens in whatever context sooner rather than later!

summary: I love to start things - companies, conversations, plans, books. The list goes on. I have a passion for teaching our future leaders, for offering advice to others in business startup mode and for making a difference in my community. That is manifest through ad agency management, university-level teaching and value creation both through companies I help found and through those I advise. Status quo doesn't mesh with my personality. I am a lifelong learner and believe I experience something important just about every day I consciously pay attention. So while I move from Thing One to Thing Two quite a bit, it's out of an eagerness to explore rather than a lack of interest. And that about sums it all up. The start.
name: Bret Giles
title: Entrepreneur, Marketer and Teacher
